channel.title: World
channel.description: The Washington Post World section provides information and analysis of breaking world news stories. In addition to our world news and video, Post World News offers discussions and blogs on major international news and economic issues.

item.title: Arab and Muslim leaders gather in Saudi Arabia for summit on Gaza war
item.dc:creator: Annabelle Timsit

item.title: Live Briefing: Saudi-hosted summit to discuss Gaza, Lebanon; Trump talks to Netanyahu
item.dc:creator: Rachel Pannett
item.description: Israel’s fight against Hamas in Gaza and Hezbollah in Lebanon is set to dominate the agenda at gatherings in Riyadh, Saudi Arabia, and the White House this week.

item.title: 20 children killed in Israeli strikes in Gaza and Lebanon, officials say
item.dc:creator: Abbie Cheeseman, Hajar Harb

item.title: Haiti’s prime minister ousted in latest blow to transition
item.dc:creator: Amanda Coletta
item.description: A council tasked with restoring order to the nation said it would replace Prime Minister Garry Conille with businessman Alix Didier Fils-Aimé.

item.title: Trump talked to Putin, told Russian leader not to escalate in Ukraine
item.dc:creator: Ellen Nakashima, John Hudson, Josh Dawsey
item.description: President-elect Donald Trump spoke with Russian President Vladimir Putin on Thursday and discussed the war in Ukraine, according to people familiar with the call.

item.title: 20 children killed in Israeli strikes in Gaza and Lebanon, officials say
item.dc:creator: Abbie Cheeseman, Hajar Harb
item.description: The deadly attacks came as Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu said Sunday he has spoken with President-elect Donald Trump three times in recent days.

item.title: Dozens killed in strikes in Gaza and Lebanon, officials say
item.dc:creator: Annabelle Timsit, Abbie Cheeseman, Rachel Pannett
item.description: Strikes in northern Gaza and across Lebanon killed at least 20 children, officials said, highlighting the toll of Israel’s war against militant groups on local populations.

item.title: Israeli strikes in Lebanon kill at least 7 children and 10 paramedics, among others
item.dc:creator: Abbie Cheeseman

item.title: Ukraine launches biggest drone attack yet on Moscow
item.dc:creator: Francesca Ebel, Natalia Abbakumova, Kostiantyn Khudov, David Stern
item.description: Russia’s Defense Ministry said its air defense systems intercepted 70 Ukrainian drones over six regions, including 34 over the Moscow region.

item.title: Dozens killed in overnight strike in Jabalya, health officials say
item.dc:creator: Annabelle Timsit, Abbie Cheeseman

item.title: Analysis: In Gaza, ‘an entire society now a graveyard’
item.dc:creator: Ishaan Tharoor

item.title: Qatar halts role as cease-fire broker while panel warns of famine in Gaza
item.dc:creator: Bryan Pietsch, John Hudson, Kareem Fahim, Abbie Cheeseman

item.title: Russia is shrinking; the Kremlin says ‘child-free’ ideology is to blame
item.dc:creator: Robyn Dixon, Natalia Abbakumova
item.description: A new bill against “child-free propaganda” criminalizes advocating for not having children. It could affect TV, movies and social media posts.

item.title: In Gaza, ‘an entire society now a graveyard’
item.dc:creator: Ishaan Tharoor
item.description: The devastation in northern Gaza, now the focus of a punishing Israeli military campaign, has stunned veteran aid officials.

item.title: Qatar halts role as cease-fire broker while panel warns of famine in Gaza
item.dc:creator: Bryan Pietsch, John Hudson, Kareem Fahim, Abbie Cheeseman
item.description: Qatar has paused mediation efforts for a cease-fire in Gaza, saying it would resume only when the parties are serious enough to end “the brutal war.”

item.title: ‘Imminent’ famine likely in northern Gaza, experts warn in alert
item.dc:creator: Frances Vinall, Victoria Bisset, Bryan Pietsch
item.description: The IPC Famine Review Committee said it was clear the worst-case scenario its analysts had developed earlier was “now playing out in areas of the northern Gaza Strip.”

item.title: Four people held after attacks on Israeli soccer fans in Amsterdam
item.dc:creator: Karla Adam
item.description: Prime Minister Dick Schoof canceled a trip to U.N. climate talks following the attacks, which erupted around a soccer match between Dutch and Israeli teams.

item.title: Hamas should no longer be welcomed in Qatar, U.S. tells Doha
item.dc:creator: John Hudson

item.title: Pentagon to appeal ruling that affirms plea deals for 9/11 defendants
item.dc:creator: Missy Ryan
item.description: A judge’s decision to allow plea deals in three 9/11 cases sets up a confrontation with Defense Secretary Lloyd Austin, who opposes the Guantánamo court ruling.

item.title: Israel striking Lebanon 101 times per day, according to Post analysis
item.dc:creator: Kareem Fahim, Abbie Cheeseman

item.title: What to know about Trump’s history of support for Israel
item.dc:creator: Kelsey Ables, Frances Vinall

item.title: Attacks on Israeli soccer fans a ‘black night’ for Amsterdam, mayor says
item.dc:creator: Loveday Morris, Jintak Han, Alon Rom
